alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:30AM HST until January 28 at 12:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Molokai in Maui County * Until 1245 PM HST. * At 930 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain continuing to fall over a large portion of the island of Molokai, with peak rain rates near 2 inches per hour. Water levels in gulches and streams remain elevated, and flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the entire island of Molokai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1245 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
